meanings.definition: To estimate the value of something too highly.
meanings.sent1: She tends to overvaluation her old belongings when pricing them for sale.
meanings.sent2: It is important not to overvaluation your skills during a job interview.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that his cat tends to overvaluation its own worth.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him made her overvaluation his every action.
meanings.sent5: The children's excitement over the new toy was an example of overvaluation.

meanings.definition: The act of valuing something too highly.
meanings.sent1: The overvaluation of the painting led to a disappointing auction result.
meanings.sent2: Investors should be cautious of overvaluation in the stock market.
meanings.sent3: The overvaluation of the dessert made it seem more delicious than it actually was.
meanings.sent4: The overvaluation of her beauty by others made her uncomfortable.
meanings.sent5: The overvaluation of his importance in the project caused tension among the team.
